PROJECTS TAKEN.Description:
A financial data processor used for processing of various trade finance products like LC/Bills/Collections across 85 countries by various banks including Citi.
 EDPMS : Worked on generation of end of the reports which get uploaded on EDPMS, an RBI application.
GreenTrade :  Developed a software for upload/delete/authorization of documents from TRIMS to another server.
Generic Upload : Developed a software for bulk upload of data by users to database bypassing TRIMS processing.
Worked on multiple enhancements and fixed multiple issues in the existing system.

This project involved implementation of a tool to assign, monitor and grade the tasks of all the employees enrolled in the grad programme at Citi. It also helps to track their progress, take their feedback and give feedback on various tasks assigned to them.

A tool for guiding and planning each phase of project development.This tool provided a centralized requirements sheet accessible to each team member and a centralized resources pool accessible to the administrator. The user can add, delete or review a requirement.

Mining of Statistically Significant Substrings using the LZ78 Data Compression
Algorithm. Designed various algorithms based on LZ78 data compression algorithm in order to detect statistically significant substrings. Experimentally found that difference in entropy of two distributions and KL Divergence of one distribution from another can both be used as significance
measures.

PROJECTS TAKEN.Title of Project: Migration of Azure Networking host plugins from FDHE deployment pipeline to Autopilot
PROJECTS TAKEN.Description:
Previously host plugins in Azure SDN stack used FDHE (fabric driven hosting environment) model for deployment across the Azure fleet. In this project, I worked on migrating the deployment pipeline from FDHE to Autopilot model. 
1. Adding migration logic to the host agents 
2. Each host plugin requires a few settings to start up which are stored in a remote server. In FDHE deployment engine was responsible for rolling out the settings to each node. In Autopilot this is solved using Autopilot data deployment. A parser was written to fetch the agent specific settings. 
3. Adding service restart and heartbeat watchdogs to the plugins for monitoring purpose. 
4. Deploying the agents across the fleet. 
5. Brown bags for VNET/DataPath team on Autopilot deployment.

Project involved implementation of various algorithms (like K-Nearest Neighbours, Neural Networks(3-Layer and 4-Layer)) for the purpose of classification of handwritten English alphabets and numerals (26 upper case, 26 lower case,10 numerals) to know the best possible method for
classification. It also involved comparison between different methods based on two different types of feature sets.
